en: Narrator: Peppa and her family are going camping.
cn: 旁白：佩奇和她的家人要去露营。

en: Daddy Pig: I love camping. We’re here.
cn: 猪爸爸：我喜欢露营。我们到了。

en: Daddy Pig: Peppa, George, this is the tent I had when I was a little boy.
cn: 猪爸爸：佩奇，乔治，这是我小时候用的帐篷。

sentence.en: This is the tent I had when I was a little boy.
sentence.cn: 这是我小时候用的帐篷。

examples.en: This is the bike I had when I was a little girl.
examples.cn: 这是我小时候用的自行车。

examples.en: This is the teddy bear I had when I was a baby.
examples.cn: 这是我小时候用的泰迪熊。

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy, how are you going to make that into a tent?
cn: 佩奇：爸爸，你怎么把它变成帐篷？

sentence.en: how are you going to make that into a tent?

examples.en: how are you going to make that into a car?
how are you going to make that into a cake?

en: Daddy Pig: Don’t worry, Peppa. I’m an expert at camping. Mummy Pig, put the tent on the poles, please.
cn: 猪爸爸：别担心，佩奇。我是露营专家。猪妈妈，请把帐篷放到杆子上。

en: Daddy Pig: That’s it. Easy as pie.
cn: 猪爸爸：好了。轻而易举。

en: Daddy Pig: Ooo.
cn: 猪爸爸：哦。

en: Mummy Pig: Do these pegs do anything?
cn: 猪妈妈：这些钉子有用吗？

examples.en: Do these ropes do anything?
Do these buttons do anything?

en: Daddy Pig: Of course, I forgot about the pegs.
cn: 猪爸爸：当然有用，我忘了钉子。

examples.en: I forgot about the ropes.
I forgot about the buttons.

en: Narrator: Pegs hold the tent up.
cn: 旁白：钉子可以把帐篷固定住。

sentence.cn: 钉子可以把帐篷固定住。

examples.en: Ropes hold the boat in place.
examples.cn: 绳子可以把船固定在原地。

examples.en: Buttons hold the shirt together.
examples.cn: 按钮可以把衬衫扣在一起。

en: Daddy Pig: There.
cn: 猪爸爸：好了。

en: Peppa Pig: The tent is a bit little.
cn: 佩奇：帐篷有点小。

en: Daddy Pig: It was big enough for me when I was a boy, but it does look a bit small now.
cn: 猪爸爸：我小时候它够大，但现在看起来有点小。

en: Mummy Pig: That’s because you’ve grown a bit since you were a boy, Daddy Pig.
cn: 猪妈妈：那是因为你长大了，猪爸爸。

en: Peppa Pig: And your tummy has grown the most of all.
cn: 佩奇：而且你的肚子长得最多。

en: Daddy Pig: Talking of tummies, we should cook supper.
cn: 猪爸爸：说到肚子，我们该做晚饭了。

examples.en: Talking of toys, let’s play with them.
Talking of food, I’m hungry.

en: Peppa Pig: Yes, yes.
cn: 佩奇：好呀，好呀。

en: Daddy Pig: First we have to collect sticks to make a fire.
cn: 猪爸爸：我们得先捡些木棍生火。

en: Peppa Pig: Yippee.
cn: 佩奇：耶！

en: Narrator: Peppa and George are helping Daddy Pig collect sticks for the campfire.
cn: 旁白：佩奇和乔治在帮猪爸爸捡柴火。

en: Peppa Pig: George, I’ll pick up the sticks and you can carry them.
cn: 佩奇：乔治，我捡木棍，你来拿。

sentence.en: I’ll pick up the sticks and you can carry them.

examples.en: I’ll pick up the toys and you can put them away.
I’ll pick up the books and you can carry them.

en: Peppa Pig: Collecting sticks is fun.
cn: 佩奇：捡木棍真有趣。

en: Daddy Pig: Good, that’s enough sticks.
cn: 猪爸爸：好了，木棍够了。

en: Daddy Pig: That’s a splendid campfire. Now I’ll light it.
cn: 猪爸爸：这堆篝火真棒。现在我来点火。

en: Mummy Pig: Here are the matches.
cn: 猪妈妈：火柴在这儿。

en: Daddy Pig: We don’t need matches.
cn: 猪爸爸：我们不需要火柴。

examples.en: We don’t need a map.
We don’t need a car.

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy, how can you light it without matches?
cn: 佩奇：爸爸，不用火柴怎么点火？

sentence.en: how can you light it without matches?

examples.en: how can you cook it without a stove?
how can you fix it without tools?

en: Daddy Pig: I’m going to make fire the old way. By simply rubbing these two sticks together.
cn: 猪爸爸：我要用老方法生火。只要把这两根木棍摩擦在一起。

sentence.en: I’m going to make fire the old way.

examples.en: I’m going to make a cake the old way.
I’m going to fix it the old way.

en: Narrator: Daddy Pig is rubbing the two sticks together to light the campfire.
cn: 旁白：猪爸爸正在摩擦两根木棍点燃篝火。

en: Peppa Pig: Where’s the fire, Daddy?
cn: 佩奇：火呢，爸爸？

en: Daddy Pig: Nearly there.
cn: 猪爸爸：快好了。

en: Peppa, Mummy Pig and George: Hurrah!
cn: 佩奇、猪妈妈和乔治：万岁！

en: Daddy Pig: Easy as pie.
cn: 猪爸爸：轻而易举。

en: Mummy Pig: Now we can heat up the tomato soup.
cn: 猪妈妈：现在可以加热番茄汤了。

en: Daddy Pig: Ah, listen to the sounds of nature.
cn: 猪爸爸：啊，听听大自然的声音。

en: Peppa Pig: What is that sound?
cn: 佩奇：那是什么声音？

examples.en: What is that noise?
What is that smell?

en: Daddy Pig: That is the sound of crickets chirping.
cn: 猪爸爸：那是蟋蟀叫的声音。

en: Peppa Pig: What is that?
cn: 佩奇：那是什么？

en: Mummy Pig: That’s an owl. Look, there it is.
cn: 猪妈妈：那是猫头鹰。看，就在那里。

en: Peppa and George: Wow.
cn: 佩奇和乔治：哇。

en: Peppa Pig: And what’s that noise?
cn: 佩奇：那又是什么声音？

en: Mummy Pig: Oh, I’m not sure.
cn: 猪妈妈：哦，我不确定。

examples.en: I’m not sure what that is.
I’m not sure how to do it.

en: Peppa Pig: It’s Daddy’s tummy.
cn: 佩奇：是爸爸的肚子。

en: Daddy Pig: My tummy rumbling is one of the best sounds of nature. It means it’s time to eat.
cn: 猪爸爸：我肚子咕咕叫也是大自然最美的声音之一。这说明该吃饭了。

points.cn: 大自然最美的声音之一

points.en: it means it’s time to eat

en: Peppa Pig: I love tomato soup.
cn: 佩奇：我喜欢番茄汤。

en: Daddy Pig: So do I.
cn: 猪爸爸：我也是。

en: Mummy Pig: There’s another one of Daddy Pig’s sounds of nature.
cn: 猪妈妈：又有一个猪爸爸的大自然声音。

en: Daddy Pig: What?
cn: 猪爸爸：什么？

en: Mummy Pig: Come on, children. Into the tent. It’s bedtime.
cn: 猪妈妈：来吧，孩子们。进帐篷，该睡觉了。

en: Peppa Pig: We won’t all fit in. The tent is too little.
cn: 佩奇：我们都进不去，帐篷太小了。

en: Daddy Pig: It will be fine. In you go.
cn: 猪爸爸：没关系，进去吧。

en: Daddy Pig: Move further in, Mummy Pig.
cn: 猪爸爸：猪妈妈，再往里挪挪。

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy, you’re too big for the tent.
cn: 佩奇：爸爸，你太大了，进不去帐篷。

en: Daddy Pig: Never mind. I’d rather sleep outside anyway.
cn: 猪爸爸：没关系，我还是喜欢在外面睡。

examples.en: I’d rather play outside anyway.
I’d rather eat outside anyway.

en: Mummy Pig: Good night, Daddy Pig.
cn: 猪妈妈：晚安，猪爸爸。

en: Peppa Pig: Good night, Daddy.
cn: 佩奇：晚安，爸爸。

en: George: Night-night.
cn: 乔治：晚安。

en: Daddy Pig: Good night, everyone.
cn: 猪爸爸：大家晚安。

en: Narrator: Mummy Pig, Peppa and George are sleeping in the tent. Daddy Pig is sleeping outside under the stars.
cn: 旁白：猪妈妈、佩奇和乔治在帐篷里睡觉。猪爸爸在星空下睡觉。

en: Daddy Pig: I love camping, sleeping in the open air with the stars above me.
cn: 猪爸爸：我喜欢露营，喜欢在星空下露天睡觉。

en: Daddy Pig: Maybe this wasn’t such a good idea after all.
cn: 猪爸爸：也许这主意不太好。

sentence.en: Maybe this wasn’t such a good idea after all.

examples.en: Maybe this wasn’t such a good plan after all.
Maybe this wasn’t such a good choice after all.

en: Narrator: It is morning.
cn: 旁白：天亮了。

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy, it was lovely and cosy in the tent. Oh, where’s Daddy?
cn: 佩奇：爸爸，帐篷里又暖和又舒服。咦，爸爸去哪儿了？

points.en: lovely and cosy in the tent

en: Narrator: Daddy Pig has gone.
cn: 旁白：猪爸爸不见了。

en: Mummy Pig: Poor Daddy Pig. He must have been cold and wet. And now where is he?
cn: 猪妈妈：可怜的猪爸爸，他一定又冷又湿。现在他在哪儿？

en: Mummy Pig: What’s that sound?
cn: 猪妈妈：那是什么声音？

en: Peppa Pig: It sounds like snoring.
cn: 佩奇：听起来像打呼噜。

examples.en: It sounds like singing.
It sounds like laughing.

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy Pig!
cn: 佩奇：猪爸爸！

en: Daddy Pig: What?
cn: 猪爸爸：什么？

en: Peppa Pig: Daddy, you’re safe.
cn: 佩奇：爸爸，你没事。

en: Daddy Pig: Of course I’m safe. I’m an expert at camping. I slept in the car.
cn: 猪爸爸：我当然没事。我是露营专家。我在车里睡的。

en: Peppa Pig: Silly Daddy.
cn: 佩奇：傻爸爸。

en: Daddy Pig: I love camping.
cn: 猪爸爸：我喜欢露营。
